ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Right-sided Otosclerosis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of previously diagnosed otosclerosis, conductive hearing loss with Carhart's notch at 2000 Hz, and excellent speech recognition.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity and determine the type and degree of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrates asymmetric hearing with normal sensitivity in the left ear and a moderate conductive hearing loss in the right ear. The right ear exhibits a characteristic Carhart's notch at 2000 Hz. Speech recognition is excellent bilaterally. Findings are consistent with the reported history of right-sided otosclerosis.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Moderate rising to mild conductive loss (250-1500 Hz), Carhart's notch at 2000 Hz, sloping to mild conductive loss. PTA 35 dB HL. Left ear: Normal hearing (0-10 dB HL), PTA 12 dB HL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: SRT 35 dB HL, WRS 96% at 75 dB HL. Left ear: SRT 12 dB HL, WRS 92% at 60 dB HL.

proposed_items: Referral to otologist for surgical intervention (stapedectomy)
counseling_actions: Explain the nature of conductive hearing loss and potential for improvement

escalation.rationale_short: For evaluation of surgical intervention (stapedectomy) for otosclerosis.
